body.p: CSSSelector was inroduced as part of the HTML5/CSS2 initiativ. In many ways you may say that it is for webprogrammers what XPATH is for XML-programmers. A CSSselector make it possible to identify element(s) on a webpage combing the structure (HTML) and the stylesheet (CSS).
WXT use CSSSelector when importing HTML fragments from HTML-pages. The syntax is rather involved and you may find support at jsoup, at w3schools and the reference document at w3org.
Just a few very simple examples

tr.td: all e-elements with a attribute with value b
all e-elements with a attribute where value b exist in a whitespace-separated list of values
all e-elements with a attribute where the value starts with b
all e-elements with a attribute where the value ends with b
all e-elements with a attribute containing b
